intro: Cardamine bijiangensis, commonly known as the Bijiang watercress, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other members like cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain streams and forest floors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
